sec.div: Unit 1: Basal sands and gravels (Cudmore Grove Channel Gravel)
sec.p: The floor of the channel is lined with sands and gravels that form the basal member of the Pleistocene sequence and directly overlie London Clay. These reach a maximum recorded thickness (3.10 m) in borehole CG1 ( Fig. 4), then thin progressively south-westwards towards the channel margin, where they taper into a 1–2 cm pebble lag ( Figs. 4 and 5), the ‘Cudmore Grove Channel lag’ ( Bridgland et al., 1988). The persistence of Unit 1 to the northeast of borehole CG1 is unknown.
